title: Newcastle vs Arsenal LIVE : Premier League latest score and goal updates
body_text:
Arsenal won 2-1 at Newcastle United on Sunday in a Premier League clash packed with plenty of drama and controversial moments.
The Gunners were denied a first-half penalty when Nick Pope appeared to hack down Viktor Gyokeres – which was initially given before VAR intervened and referee Jarred Gillett went to the monitor – with replays showing that Pope touched the ball before bringing the striker down.
Nick Woltemade handed Newcastle the lead in the 35th minute but Arsenal felt it shouldn’t have counted – as the German appeared to push Gabriel Magalhaes before he headed past David Raya – but VAR deemed it to be minimal contact.
Mikel Merino came off the bench and equalised with six minutes of normal time to go, with Newcastle then denied a penalty by VAR before Gabriel scored a 96th-minute winner from a corner as Arsenal moved up to second in the top-flight table to close the gap to Liverpool to two points.
Here’s how it all unfolded..

Metro at the Match: Newcastle 1-2 Arsenal
Metro at the Match returns to bring you all the analysis from the biggest games of the season.
Here are our team’s key takeaways from Newcastle 1-2 Arsenal.
Arsenal’s squad depth wins game
‘Subs, replacements, finishers – call them what you want – but one thing is clear: Arsenal’s squad depth will be a vital tool in their bid to win the title this year. Gabriel Martinelli last week and Mikel Merino this around, Arteta’s second-half changes continue to get his side goals when they need them most.’ Ben Fleming – Sports Reporter.
Thiaw looks a great addition
‘In a transfer window awash with sagas, Malick Thiaw arriving at Newcastle from AC Milan went under the radar. The defender was fantastic here, dealing with Gyokeres impressively. Physically imposing and technically good on the ball.’ – Phil Haigh – Sports Reporter.
Arteta’s team selection back under microscope
‘Mikel Arteta’s team selection is back under the microscope after the benching of William Saliba on Sunday, particularly given the struggles of his replacement Cristhian Mosquera, who was hauled off at the break. Arteta said Saliba’s fitness still has to be managed – so why was he given the full 90 minutes against Port Vale in midweek?’ – Ben Fleming – Sports Reporter.
Woltemade a new hero but Magpies still blunt
‘Newcastle have struggled for goals so far this season and they weren’t exactly free-flowing in attack on Sunday. Nick Woltemade has made a decent start and the giant German is a threat in the air, but Magpies fans will be relishing the return to fitness of Yoane Wissa to spark some attacking verve.’ – Phil Haigh – Sports Reporter.
Was it a penalty?
‘Viktor Gyokeres was felled by Nick Pope and a penalty given but the Newcastle goalkeeper was saved by VAR as he got a slight touch on the ball. The decision remained debateable. Clear and obvious error? Surely not.’ – Phil Haigh – Sports Reporter.
Eze shines for Arsenal
‘Finally deployed in a central attacking position, Eberechi Eze was a bright spot for the Gunners. Martin Odegaard has made that position his own in recent years, but Arteta may soon be forced to consider if his captain is the best man for the job in the coveted No10 role.’ – Ben Fleming – Sports Reporter.
That’s all from us!
Thanks for joining our live blog today! Stay with Metro for all the best reaction to this game and more.
Oh – and make sure you pick up a copy of our newspaper tomorrow morning.
See you soon!
FULL TIME: Newcastle 1-2 Arsenal
That was pure Barclays, as some might say.
What a game of football… Arsenal turn it around with two late goals to take all three points at St James’ Park. They’re up to second and have closed the gap to Liverpool to two points!
Gabriel scores 96th-minute winner!
90+6: OH. MY. WORD. ARSENAL HAVE DONE IT!!!!!
Gabriel Magalhaes scores a header from a corner and the Gunners have turned it around from 1-0 down. This is a massive result!!!
Barnes on for Newcastle
90+4: Barnes comes on for Newcastle, replacing Joelinton.
Eight minutes added on!
90+3: There’s eight minutes added on, by the way. Are we set for even more drama?
Trossard comes off
89: Lewis-Skelly comes on for Trossard. Is Arteta playing for a point?
Two more yellows
89: Just before the Arsenal goal, Joelinton was booked and Burn has also now just been shown a yellow card. Really feisty out there…
Newcastle denied a penalty!
87: More drama here – blimey – this has been a controversial game!
The ball clearly hits Gabriel on the arm inside the Newcastle box but he gets away with it following a VAR check after it appeared to hit his shin first.
Merino equalises for Arsenal!
84: GOAL! Another Arsenal substitute saves the day. It’s Mikel Merino!
Arsenal take a short corner and Merino gets on the end of Rice’s cross, flicking a brilliant header into the bottom corner.
Pope had no chance with that one. 1-1 at St James’ Park!
Chance for Gyokeres!
82: Gyokeres slips and wastes another Arsenal chance. He’s been poor, again.
Change for Arsenal – Odegaard has come on for Zubimendi.
Livramento stretchered off
76: Livramento is stretchered off with what looks to be a knee injury. He’s replaced by Lascelles.
Chance for Gyokeres!
71: Gyokeres shoots from a tight angle but it takes a deflection and drops wide of the post. Newcastle still leading 1-0 here.
Arsenal make double change
70: Saka and Calafiori head to the bench. The Arsenal duo are replaced by Martinelli and Merino.
Newcastle make triple change
67: Eddie Howe is taking off Murphy, Gordon and goalscorer Woltemade.
They’re replaced by Elanga, Trippier and Osula. Looks like Newcastle are going with a back five.
Chance for Murphy!
64: What a run from Newcastle’s Murphy but it’s great defending from Rice to block his shot.
Newcastle defending well
63: Wonder how long it’ll be before Arteta makes an attacking change because Newcastle are defending so well here.
Trossard dives!
60: Trossard dives inside the box, trying to win a penalty. No chance.
Chance for Timber!
59: Pope is having the game of his life. Another top save denies Timber’s header inside the box.
Chance for Joelinton!
58: Newcastle almost take a 2-0 lead… Gordon picks out Joelinton but his shot goes just wide of the far post.
